newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM SAYS 26,000 TONNES LOST TO STRIKE.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM SAYS 26,000 TONNES LOST TO STRIKE.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) said on Wednesday it lost 26,000 tonnes of ore output during a three-day strike at Nchanga Division that ended on Monday.
A statement said the ore represented 780 tonnes of contained copper.
Earlier the company said it had sacked 97 miners at Nchanga over the strike and for vandalising company property on Monday.
The miners, on strike to push for bonus pay, vandalised part of a three km stretch of underground lighting, prompting management to call police to restore order at the plant.
Nchanga is responsible for about 50 percent of ZCCM production. ZCCM copper production totalled 25,141 tonnes in August when cobalt output was 441 tonnes.
